intro: Lachenalia stayneri, commonly known as the Stayner's lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in winter, producing clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia stayneri is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
